question.title: HttpOnly SameSite=None cookie not persisted on mobile, works on desktop
question.body:
I'm working on a Spring Boot backend with React frontend. I'm setting an HttpOnly cookie for refresh tokens like this:

@NotNull
private ResponseEntity<String> getStringResponseEntity(HttpServletResponse response, UserDetails userDetails, Authentication auth) {
    String accessToken = jwtService.getToken(userDetails);
    String refreshToken = jwtService.getRefreshToken(auth.getName());

    ResponseCookie cookie = ResponseCookie.from("refresh_token", refreshToken)
            .path("/")
            .maxAge(432000)
            .httpOnly(true)
            .secure(true) // only sends over HTTPS
            .sameSite("None")
            .build();

    response.addHeader(HttpHeaders.SET_COOKIE, cookie.toString());

    return ResponseEntity.ok()
            .header(HttpHeaders.AUTHORIZATION, "Bearer " + accessToken)
            .header(HttpHeaders.ACCESS_CONTROL_EXPOSE_HEADERS, "Authorization")
            .build();
}
  • Backend: running on "https://my-backend.ngrok.app"
  • Frontend: running on "https://my-frontend.ngrok.app"

On desktop browsers, the refresh token cookie is correctly set and sent with requests. On mobile browsers, the cookie is never stored and requests fail unless I disable cross-site restrictions (SameSite) entirely.

I've tried:

sameSite("None") with secure(true)

Making sure frontend and backend are on HTTPS via Ngrok

Question:

Why does the refresh token cookie work on desktop but not mobile when using HttpOnly and SameSite=None? Are there mobile-specific restrictions on cookies with cross-site requests in Spring Boot + React setups?

Additional info:

React makes requests with Axios:

const API = axios.create({
  baseURL: "https://my-backend.ngrok.app",
  withCredentials: true
});
  • Java 21
  • Mobile tested on iOS Safari

Any guidance on how to make persistent cookies work across mobile browsers in this cross-origin setup would be appreciated.
